sentences.english: Some authors should be paid by the quantity NOT written.
sentences.chinese: 某些作者，应该按他们没有写下的分量来付稿费。

sentences.english: Beauty shes want to use earn fees to transfer, but for political huan huan is not politics.
sentences.chinese: 美妍想用赚到的稿费帮政桓换车，但政桓不要。

sentences.english: He wasn't paid for it, but still, one editor had praised his work.
sentences.chinese: 没有稿费，但他的作品受到一名编辑的赞扬。

sentences.english: And the price was splendid, even though it was for the poem of a century.
sentences.chinese: 即使这首诗可称世纪之作，稿费也还是很高的。

sentences.english: I'm using my new book advance to pay fancy decorator.
sentences.chinese: 我已经提前把新书的稿费付装修费了。

sentences.english: For the next year Jo continued to write these stories and earn money.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的一年，乔写作不辍，赚取稿费。

definition: fee paid to an author for a piece of writing
to reward/to tip/to give a gratuity
to submit articles for publication/to contribute (writing)
the author takes sole responsibility for the views expressed here (disclaimer)
piece of writing submitted for publication/manuscript/article
to settle a bill/to close an account
to set aside for/to keep as
